settings.title: How can I collab with Sheertex?
settings.text: For all partnership, influencer, or press inquiries, please email marketing@sheertex.com

settings.title: Are there COVID-19 (Coronavirus) issues with sending and receiving packages?
settings.text: We ship next-day directly from our facility in Canada. Regarding receiving packages at this time, the World Health Organization has made the following statement: ‚ÄúIs it safe to receive a package from any area where COVID-19 has been reported? Yes. The likelihood of an infected person contaminating commercial goods is low and the risk of catching the virus that causes COVID-19 from a package that has been moved, traveled, and exposed to different conditions and temperature is also low‚Äù.

settings.title: I emailed customer service, but I haven't heard back.
settings.text: Our Customer Team is happy to help with any concerns you may have! Sometimes our emails get filtered into Spam inboxes, so make sure you check yours. You can also make sure that you've added hello@sheertex.com to your email whitelist. If you're having any issues hearing back from us over email, please don't hesitate to give us a call or use our live chat!

settings.title: What‚Äôs the difference between Sheertex and regular tights?
settings.text:
When we say we‚Äôre the creators behind the strongest tights on the market today, we mean it. All our hosiery products are made with our Sheertex proprietary knit, which contains fibers that are traditionally used in mountain climbing equipment.

The Sheertex proprietary knit is not only strong, but also carries properties that make our tights stand out from the crowd. It‚Äôs naturally cooling, lightweight, and water resistant, which make our products both comfortable and high performance.

settings.title: Are they worth it?
settings.text: Our products are ethically designed in, manufactured in and shipped from our facility based in Montreal, Canada, by employees who are paid fair wages. Our product is a long-lasting solution in an industry that has been largely disposable up until now.

settings.title: What are they made of?
settings.text:
Our products are made with our Sheertex proprietary knit, which is a patent-pending blend of fibers that was developed in-house.

Please contact us directly if you have any allergy concerns. Most of our products contain Nylon and Spandex, and some products have silicone stay-ups to ensure the best fit.

settings.title: Where can I buy your products?
settings.text: We sell directly to consumers through our online store.

settings.title: How do I find my perfect size & color?
settings.text:
We have a size guide for each of our products to ensure that you can find the perfect fit.

We currently offer six nude shades:

N02 - Light: best for neutral and rosy undertones
N04 - Light Medium: best for neutral, golden, and olive undertones
N06 - Medium: best for deep golden, olive, and rosy undertones
N08 - Light Brown: best for neutral and golden undertones
N10 - Medium Brown: best for neutral undertones
N12 - Deep Brown: best for neutral and rosy undertones

Each shade is engineered to blend into skin tones close to it, for a light, barely-there look when worn. If you‚Äôd like to see a model in a specific shade on any of our nude product pages, simply select the appropriate color and a corresponding photo will be shown.¬†

Of course, if you have any questions about our colors or sizing, please drop us a line at¬†hello@sheertex.com¬†and one of our experts will be happy to help you out.

settings.title: Can I throw them in the wash?
settings.text: We suggest hand-washing your products in cold water and letting them air dry. They are also machine-washable, but we recommend putting them in an intimates bag (or a pillowcase) and using the delicates cycle. Our products are not fond of bleach, fabric softeners, or ironing boards. To ensure a long-lasting relationship with your Sheertex product, handle them with care.

settings.title: Do you make products other than pantyhose?
settings.text: Yes, we do! We make shorts, socks, accessories and more. Stay tuned on new product launches by subscribing to our newsletter and following us on social media.

settings.title: How can I track the status of my order?
settings.text: We‚Äôll be sending you email updates throughout the entire journey of your package. You‚Äôll be kept up to date with an order confirmation, an out-for-delivery update, as well as a tracking number to see exactly where your package is from the moment it has shipped to the arrival at its final destination.

settings.title: I‚Äôve submitted my order but need to make a change, what do I do?
settings.text: Our goal is to process your order as efficiently and accurately as possible, therefore we cannot guarantee that an order can be changed or cancelled once it has been placed. Please call us at 1 (800) 715-1658 as soon as possible so that we can try our best to make the change required before your order is shipped. Our customer support team is available from 9 AM to 9 PM EST. If you've made an order that needs to be changed outside of that timeframe, please call us the next day as early as possible to increase the chances of us being able to intercept your order before it ships!

settings.title: How do I apply a discount code to my order?
settings.text: You can apply a discount code at checkout. Note that only one discount code, promotion, and/or sale can be applied per order. Discount codes are not applicable during ongoing sales.

settings.title: My discount code isn't working.
settings.text: All our promotional discount codes have a minimum order value of $50 USD. Double check your cart to make sure you‚Äôve added enough items! If the problem still persists, the code may be expired. Please reach out to our customer experience team if you have any additional questions or concerns around your discount code.

settings.title: I live in Montreal, can I come pick up my order at your facility?
settings.text: Unfortunately, we aren‚Äôt currently set up for pick-ups at our Montreal facility.

settings.title: Do your products have a guarantee?
settings.text: Yes! Our 90 Day Good Luck Guarantee covers any damages on all tights products that render them unwearable, observed within the first 90 days from the date of arrival. Reach out to us at the email or phone number below, and we‚Äôll get you started on our quick replacement process. If your tights are eligible for the guarantee, we‚Äôll send you a replacement at no additional cost, including shipping. Please note that any Sheertex products not purchased directly from our website may not be eligible for our 90 Day Guarantee.

settings.title: What‚Äôs your return policy?
settings.text: Most of our products are intimates products, so once they leave our facility, they cannot be returned. All orders are final sale for this reason. If you have any questions or concerns, please email¬†hello@sheertex.com¬†and we‚Äôll be happy to help.

settings.title: How long will my order take to ship?
settings.text:
We fulfill all orders directly from our factory in Montreal, Quebec. We process orders as soon as possible, so most products are shipped the same day. Shipping takes 3-5 business days on average for shipments going to the US and Canada, from the moment the order leaves our facility.

You will receive a tracking number by email once your order has shipped, and you‚Äôll be able to follow your order‚Äôs journey from our home to yours.

settings.title: Can I pay for expedited shipping?
settings.text:
Absolutely! We have a few options when it comes to shipping. While we offer free shipping on all orders, you can choose a faster option for an additional fee. All shipping options come with a tracking link that will be emailed to you once your item has left our warehouse.

-Free (21 Business Days)
-Expedited (5-6 Business Days): $5 USD
-Express Shipping (2-3 Business Days): $15 USD

settings.title: Where do you ship your products to?
settings.text:
We currently ship our products to Canada, the US, the UK, and the EU. You can toggle the currency displayed on the site by clicking the flag icon beside "Select your currency" at the bottom of every page.

If you're shopping from Australia or New Zealand, please visit our Oceania site at¬†au.sheertex.com.

settings.title: There is an error in the shipping address that I provided, what do I do?
settings.text: Mistakes happen! If you‚Äôve made an error in your shipping address, please call us at 1 (800) 715-1658 as soon as possible. We will only be able to edit your shipping address before your order leaves our facility, so please let us know how we can help right away. We cannot guarantee any changes after the order has been submitted online. Once the order has been shipped, we are not able to change anything. Please refer to the shipping carrier's website for resources on how to redirect an order when it‚Äôs en route. Many shipping carriers have options to do this‚Äîyou will have to contact the shipping carrier and provide the necessary information about your order. Note that some shipping carriers will charge a fee for re-routing.

settings.title: What kind of payment methods can I use to place an order?
settings.text:
We accept a variety of payment options:

Express Checkout (Amazon Pay, Google Pay, PayPal, Shop Pay), Credit Card (Visa, Mastercard, Amex and more), and Buy Now Pay Later options (AfterPay, Sezzle).

settings.title: When will I be charged after placing an order?
settings.text: Charges are processed in our system the moment an order is placed so we can get your package out to you as soon as possible. It may take up to 1-2 business days for the charge to be reflected on your bank statement.

settings.title: Contact Us
settings.text:
Are you a customer who needs help? That‚Äôs what we're here for!

For questions about an¬†order or products; email us at hello@sheertex.com or call call us 1-800-715-1658. You can also¬†check out our¬†FAQs, the answer might be waiting for you there!

settings.title: Our Materials
settings.text: There hadn’t been any innovation in the hosiery industry since Joseph Shivers’ spandex in 1958. Then we came along.

settings.title: We take pantyhose seriously.
settings.text:
We use a blend of miniaturized, super-strong polymer (the kind that goes into ballistic materials and climbing equipment), nylon and spandex to create a lightweight, flexible formula. This is our proprietary knit.

We’re truly the first of our kind in this industry: the texture, functionality, and durability are unique to Sheertex. We have a formula so strong we had to retrofit our sewing machines to be able to handle the scale of our production, and the strength of our knit.

settings.title_1: We‚Äôre 10x stronger than the other guys
settings.text_1: For real. With a tensile strength of 4000-6000 pounds per square inch, we are the most durable hosiery on the market.
settings.text_2: We’ve turned bulletproof vests into an everyday wardrobe staple by ensuring our knit is flexible and comfortable all day and all night.
settings.text_3: Our fiber has an absorption rate of virtually zero. Our knit’s resistance to water and moisture means that our products will never lose their strength due to swelling caused by the absorption of water.

settings.text_1: Our sheers also have a high bonding resistance to anything and everything. This means that our fiber is completely nontoxic and safe to wear all day, everyday.
settings.text_2: Part of our magic is making such a powerful polymer into wearable pantyhose. Our products are breathable and quickly transfer heat, creating a cooling effect. Pantyhose have never been so comfortable.
settings.text_3: Our sheers will keep you comfortable, no matter the conditions. Our sheers are silky soft, super stretchy, and have a cotton gusset hand-sewn in for extra breathability.

settings.text:
Select Responsibilities:

• Communicate with customers to identify/assess needs and react accordingly to achieve customer satisfaction

• Utilize various communication methods to interact with customers (phone, email, live chat, social media, etc.)

• Answer questions on all aspects of the company (warranties, terms of sale, sizing, products)

• Assist in collecting data on overall customer satisfaction

• Work with customer service manager to learn about company product changes and achieve the highest levels of customer satisfaction

For more information:

settings.title: UI / UX Designer
settings.text:
Select Responsibilities:

• Experience creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, visual designs, and mobile prototypes as well as clear documentation.

• Bachelor’s Degree in Design or equivalent

• Ability to articulate UX design decisions to non-designers

• Involvement in designing and conducting usability testing, engage ability testing, and UX research

• Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, and XD or other prototyping tools.

• Solid understanding of front-end development and are comfortable talking to developers about the details of style sheets and CSS implementation.

• Applicants must provide a portfolio

settings.title: Sheertex Sidekick
settings.text: We're Reimagining the Most Durable Pantyhose on the Market: Still Sustainable. Still Our Revolutionary Knit. More Accessible.

settings.text_1: Just like our original collection, Sidekick is powered by our revolutionary Sheertex Knit Technology. Invented and manufactured in Canada, our special recipe has turned the world’s strongest polymer into lightweight, comfortable pantyhose. You won’t find anything like us anywhere else.
settings.text_2: To make Sidekick possible we retrofit state-of-the-art automatic sewing machines to be able to handle the most durable hosiery on the planet. This more efficient process of automatic sewing allows us to bring you a more affordable product. Because everyone deserves to feel unbreakable.
settings.text_3: Over 2 billion pairs of pantyhose end up in landfills each year. We believe there’s no longer an excuse for pantyhose that can't get through the day. Our sheers are 10X stronger than the other guys. Not only will our products help you look and feel your best, we’re committed to doing the same for Mother Nature.

settings.text_3: Questions? Feedback? Love notes? We'd love to hear from you!
settings.chat_with_us: Open Chat

settings.subtitle: What we care about
settings.title: Our Values
settings.text: A committed relationship between you, Sheertex, and the planet.

The pantyhose industry has historically been a purposefully disposable industry, creating enormous waste. Each year, over 2 billion pairs of tights are produced, and because of their intentionally flimsy composition, most of them are sent straight into the landfill after just one use. We believe that this waste is unacceptable, and we set out to make the change we wanted to see in the industry.

We pride ourselves on creating the most durable sheers around -- 10x stronger than the other guys and built to last. Made from super-strong polymer, we created a knit blend able to withstand the elements, while still being lightweight and comfortable. By investing in high-quality products that are designed to last a long time, we’re actively fighting against the disposability of the hosiery industry. We’re also working hard on developing our recycling program, and implementing ethical strategies to reduce waste.

We recognize that although Sheertex is revolutionary in the industry, we’re not perfect. We devote ourselves to ensuring that you get the best pantyhose possible. When a near-flawless pair pantyhose doesn’t pass the quality assurance test, we turn them into something new.

We transform every pair of slightly imperfect pantyhose into our Jumbo Scrunchies, which are hand-sewn by our production team with love. This is just one of the ways we make sure we’re sending you the high-quality products you deserve, without sending any pantyhose to the landfill.

Our commitment to ethical practices also includes ensuring that our employees are paid a fair and living wage. We offer equitable salaries, health benefits, and dedicate ourselves to ensuring that each member of our team has the opportunity to grow, expand their skills, and develop their career with us. We believe that happy people make happy sheers, so we aim to foster a work environment that empowers the people who make our world go ‘round.

We believe that 10 years from now, no one will buy pantyhose that rips. We have developed the technology to create a durable and high-quality product that is kind to the environment, to our employees, and to you, the consumer. We are changing the way the world sees pantyhose, one pair at a time.

settings.title: Our Story
settings.text: Before Sheertex, there was Sheerly Genius. Learn more about the journey that got us to where we are today.

Our story began in 2017, not as Sheertex, but as Sheerly Genius. Our CEO, Katherine Homuth, founded the company to solve an age-old dilemma. Humans have cured diseases, landed on the moon, built cars that drive themselves --  but pantyhose couldn’t make it through the day without falling apart.

Always up for a challenge, Kat began an 18-month research and development process. After months of trial and error, she worked with suppliers to develop a unique super-strong polymer -- the kind of stuff found in ballistic materials and climbing gear. When one of our suppliers found out that we were trying to turn CSI-grade material into lightweight pantyhose, they told us it was like turning peanuts into lemonade. But after coming up with our secret recipe, Kat turned the polymer into our ultra-strong knit technology: a one-of-a-kind formula that transforms bulletproof vests into pantyhose. It took some time, but we did what they said could never be done.

The origins of Sheertex trace back to Bracebridge, Muskoka, in a 2,100 square foot facility occupied by six employees. This is where we began shipping out our first products in January of 2019. By the time summer rolled around we were packing up our little and loyal home, and were moving Sheertex to Montreal, Quebec, taking over the largest hosiery factory in Canada (115,000 square feet!)

Our team has grown from six people to just under 200 in just a few months. Working under the  same roof, we have created an unparalleled sense of teamwork and collaboration. We’re proud to pour our love into our work, just like we did from the beginning.

Our core values revolve around that same desire to make the impossible possible. They said it couldn’t be done, but we turned peanuts into lemonade.

settings.title: We've searched the world for a lucky fiber both strong and stretchy.
settings.description: The toughest fibers in the world are typically around 1,000 denier (an industry measure of fiber thickness). Most tights range between 5-100 denier, so we needed something a bit thinner.

settings.title: A year later, we found our miracle material.
settings.description: After a long process of elimination, we discovered the strongest, most lightweight fiber in the world.

settings.title: Then we made it stretchier, strong, and stylish.
settings.description: The fiber we found was 100 denier. (For context, anything 100 denier and above could make pants or socks, but not pantyhose.) This wasn't good enough: we needed to get it to 30 denier or below in order to make sheer tights. We also needed to dye and stretch it for different shades and shapes. So we went straight to manufacturers, and with a lot of hard work and resilience, wove our very own patented knit: ultra-soft, ultra-strong, and totally versatile.

settings.title: We opened a factory to make more of our own luck.
settings.text: Traditional machinery couldn't handle our super-strong knit. So we built our own hosiery manufacturing facility from the ground up in Canada's largest hosiery factory in Montreal, the heart of the Canadian textile industry.

settings.title: How can I collab with Sheertex?

settings.title: I left a review and now I can't find it on the site.
settings.text: We take pride in being a transparent company, so we don't delete negative reviews left on our website. If you've left a review and haven't seen it on the page yet, don't worry! We moderate all reviews for inappropriate content and language, which takes a little while. Your review should be visible within the week. If you have any specific questions about your review, just let us know and we'll be happy to help.

settings.title: I left a comment on your Facebook or Instagram post and now I can't find it.
settings.text: We only delete comments containing hate speech or profanity, but we run multiple advertisement videos so you may be seeing a duplicate of one you‚Äôve previously commented on.

settings.title: I reached out and haven't heard back.
settings.text: Our team is happy to help you out! We get back to every email, phone call, and social media outreach within 2-3 business days, but sometimes our replies can get stuck in your spam folder! We recommend doing a quick check of your junk folders, and if it got lost in the big tech world, to send a follow up to hello@sheertex.com and add the address to your safe senders list.

settings.title: How sheer are your products?
settings.text: We've chosen to introduce our own standard for sheerness; grouping products into categories based on on-figure appearance. Those categories are Ultra-sheer, Sheer, Semi-Sheer, Semi-Opaque and Opaque and are always evolving. We've moved away from describing our products using denier, which is a legacy way of measuring sheerness within the disposable hosiery which uses simpler knit structures then what we use at Sheertex in achieving the unique properties of our knit. If you have any questions feel free to reach out to the team directly!

settings.title: Are they worth it?
settings.text: Our products are ethically designed in, manufactured in and shipped from our facility based in Montreal, Canada, by employees who are paid fair wages. Our product is a long-lasting solution in an industry that has been largely disposable up until now.

settings.title: How is it made?
settings.text: We are proudly Canadian and work with a talented, local workforce here in Montreal. Everything from design, manufacturing, customer support and shipping are all done in house.

settings.title: I received the wrong product.
settings.text: If you recently placed an order with us, it's possible that the label might feature another product name instead. But don't worry! The product you received is what you ordered ‚Äì it just came in a recycled box. Rather than waste packaging of renamed or older products, we're taking a sustainable approach that aligns with our goal of reducing waste. After all, what's not to love about responsible packaging?

settings.title: What are they made of?
settings.text: Our tights are made of a miniaturized version of the same polymer used in bulletproof vests and mountaineering equipment! It's something we had to spend years and years developing, and we're very proud of it. Other than our special super-strong fibre, our items also contain a lycra that allows them to stretch and to be dyed. If you're concerned about any specific possible allergens, please let us know at hello@sheertex.com!

settings.title: Do they feel like normal tights?
settings.text: Our pantyhose look and feel exactly like your typical pair of pantyhose, but better. Sheertex tights are silky and soft on the skin and comfortable to wear wherever life takes you. Our fibres are naturally antibacterial, cool to the touch, and are a miniaturized version of the fibres found in bulletproof vests and climbing equipment. We‚Äôre the most durable pantyhose on the market -- and the most comfortable if we do say so ourselves.

settings.title: Do they prevent chafing?
settings.text: Chafing is usually caused by skin on skin irritation. Wearing tights will provide a barrier to that and so will definitely help with chafing. Our special knit boasts even more comfort as they have cooling, drying and odour resistant properties to keep you feeling fresh and confident throughout the day.

settings.title: How do I wash them?
settings.text: Our tights can be thrown in the gentle cycle of a washing machine and the low heat setting of your dryer. However, for best results, we recommend to hand wash your pantyhose in cold water with a delicates detergent and let air dry. Generally, our products are not fond of bleach, fabric softeners, or ironing boards.

settings.title: My tights snagged!
settings.text: Sometimes, since our sheers are a knit rather than a solid fabric, strands of the fibre can get twisted (usually after a wash or first putting them on) into lines that look like snags. This is easily fixed! All you need to do is pinch on either side of the line with both hands at once, and tug sharply a few times, maybe wiggling on some of the more stubborn ones. We will even give our tights a nice hand wash to allow the fibres to reset; repeating the massage method if needed. Don't be afraid to really pull at the line, it should almost make a snapping sound. Our tights can take it!

settings.title: Do they snag on cat claws?
settings.text: Since they are still a fine knit, sharp objects like a cat claw can snag a single fiber strand and create temporary damage. However, most times, these damages can be massaged back into place because of how strong the fiber is. We still recommend being careful around sharp objects but you'll have guaranteed better odds with Sheertex!

settings.title: Do they snag on velcro?
settings.text: Because our tights are a fine knit, anything sharp or hooked can pierce through and pull a single or a few fiber strands. This could damage the tights but we have created the fibers to be so strong that if anything were to happen, the displaced fiber strand can be massaged back into place. It is recommended to be careful around velcro but if tights and velcro must come in contact, we're your best bet!

settings.title: Do they snag on dog paws?
settings.text: We have rave reviews from customers whose tights have passed the puppy test time and time again! We provide a Test Sock with each order for you to test out the strength of our fiber, and it makes a great chew toy ü•∞

settings.title: Do they snag on nails?
settings.text: Our tights stand up to long nails pretty well! You can see videos of this on our Instagram feed and highlights (Tests in Action). As we are a knitted product, if a sharp object such as a sharp nail actually pierces through the knit and snags an individual fiber, it can pull it out. The great news is, most times, these fibers won't break because of their strength and can be massaged back into place!

settings.title: Are they biodegradable?
settings.text: Our goal environmentally (and financially!) is to reduce the number of purchases of pantyhose overall - making sure fewer pairs of pantyhose end up in the landfill and thus you needing to buy fewer replacements over time. Although our fibre is not biodegradable, we‚Äôre aware of our impact on the environment and are proud to make our products and packaging as sustainable as possible. While individual actions do not equate to the majority of the climate crisis, each small step is a good one, and we are working towards making our product fully circular, one day! We are always trying to improve, and thus have a few other projects to reduce out footprint in the works. Currently, we have stored sheers that didn‚Äôt make it past Quality Assurance for a recycling program in the future. Our Second Chances collection is entirely made from upcycled products and extra material leftover during our production process. We are looking to expand this collection even further! We encourage everyone to shop for their lifestyle, and if our products are a part of that, great.

settings.title: Do you ship with discreet packaging?
settings.text: While our packages usually ship with only an address label, our logo on the bag, and patterned tape, we are more than able to offer discreet shipping on request for your order. Simply reach out and let us know, or make a note on any future order, and we'll be happy to ship it in a plain box. üçÄ

settings.title: Do you make custom orders?
settings.text: Thank you so much for reaching out! We're super thrilled that you thought of us when wanting to create a pair of custom tights. However, at this time we're not able to create custom designs or orders for customers. If you'd like to pass along your ideas, though, we may be able to incorporate them into future products.

settings.title: Do your masks have a nose wire?
settings.text: Our masks do not have a nose wire but are designed in a way that allows them to sit and seal comfortably on the face, even for glasses wearers.

settings.title: People still wear tights?
settings.text: Many do! If they aren't your thing, we have a variety of other items that might be more your style.

settings.title: Are they size-inclusive?
settings.text: We have sizes XS to 3XL and many videos with many different models showcasing these sizes! Just take a look at each product page for the size guide and to see the product on a wide range of body types.

settings.title: What makes them different from other brands?
settings.text:
When we say we‚Äôre the creators behind the strongest tights on the market today, we mean it. All our hosiery products are made with our Sheertex proprietary knit, which contains fibers that are traditionally used in mountain climbing equipment.

The Sheertex proprietary knit is not only strong, but also carries properties that make our tights stand out from the crowd. It‚Äôs naturally cooling, lightweight, and water resistant, which make our products both comfortable and high performance.

settings.title: Do they feel warm?
settings.text: Our tights come in a variety of thicknesses, from ultrasheer to semi-opaque. The thicker the tights the more they will protect you from the elements - like wind and cold in the winter. The fibers themselves will always feel a bit cool to the touch on the layer close to your skin due to the properties of our proprietary knit. Imagine putting your hand on wood and then on metal, the metal will often feel cooler. The coolness of the metal over other materials is caused by similar properties you‚Äôd find in our knit over other knits.

settings.title: Do they feel cool?
settings.text: Our tights come in a variety of thicknesses, from ultrasheer to semi-opaque. The thicker the tights the more they will protect you from the elements - like wind and cold in the winter. The fibers themselves will always feel a bit cool to the touch on the layer close to your skin due to the properties of our proprietary knit. Imagine putting your hand on wood and then on metal, the metal will often feel cooler. The coolness of the metal over other materials is caused by similar properties you‚Äôd find in our knit over other knits.

settings.title: Are they high-waisted?
settings.text: Our tights have a wide waistband that sits comfortably at the natural waist. This is typically a "high waisted" style. Take a look at our selection! It may be what you're looking for.

settings.title: How many wears do they last?
settings.text: The amount of wear depends on the individual and care, but being the strongest on the hosiery market, we‚Äôll definitely be your best bet for long lasting tights.

settings.title: Do you make products other than tights?
settings.text: Yes we do! We make shorts, socks, accessories and more. Stay tuned on new product launches by subscribing to our newsletter and following us on social media.

settings.title: How can I track the status of my order?
settings.text: We‚Äôll be sending you email updates throughout the entire journey of your package. You‚Äôll be kept up to date with an order confirmation, an out-for-delivery update, as well as a tracking number to see exactly where your package is from the moment it has shipped to the arrival at its final destination.

settings.title: I‚Äôve submitted my order but need to make a change, what do I do?
settings.text: Our goal is to process your order as efficiently and accurately as possible, therefore we cannot guarantee that an order can be changed or cancelled once it has been placed. Please call us at 1 (800) 715-1658 as soon as possible so that we can try our best to make the change required before your order is shipped. Our customer support team is available from 9 AM to 9 PM EST. If you've made an order that needs to be changed outside of that timeframe, please call us the next day as early as possible to increase the chances of us being able to intercept your order before it ships!

settings.title: Do your products have a guarantee?
settings.text:
Our tights are made strong with Sheertex Knit Technology and are covered under our guarantee for the first 90 days upon receiving your order.

All Sheertex tights come with a 90-day no-rip guarantee (with the exclusion of our Essential Sheer Tights, which comes with a 30-day guarantee). If your tights become irreparably damaged within 90 days from the day you received the product, send a photo of the damaged product to hello@sheertex.com for our customer service team to review. If approved, you will be sent a replacement at no additional cost. Please note that standard signs of wear and tear (ex. pilling) are not covered by our warranty. While our knit is stronger and made with higher quality materials than any competitor, you can expect to see signs of typical wear just as you would with any other garment.¬†

We thank you for your trust in our mission towards sustainability and are here to support you.¬†

For any inquiries, please contact hello@sheertex.com.

*Purchases made after January 4th, 2022 are entitled to a 90 day guarantee with the exception of our Essential Sheer Tights which are entitled to a 30 day guarantee.

settings.title: If they're so strong, why is your guarantee only 90 days?
settings.text: After a multitude of tests, we noticed that a defective product shows damage within the first 90 days of use. While our tights are the strongest on the market, they are still a fine knit, and at the end of the day, an article of clothing. Much like a sweater or pair of pants, you can choose higher quality materials that cost more and will last longer, but sweaters and pants do not come with lifetime guarantees.

settings.title: Were your tights delivered with the wrong label?
settings.text:
If you recently placed an order with us, it's possible that the label might feature another product name instead. But don't worry!

The product you received is what you ordered ‚Äì it just came in a recycled box. Rather than waste packaging of renamed or older products, we're taking a sustainable approach that aligns with our goal of reducing waste. After all, what's not to love about responsible packaging?

Products affected:
Nude Products: Labels may mention light nude (N04), medium nude (N06), dark nude (N10).
Nude Ultrasheers: Labels may mention a denier level of 20 instead of 15.
Semi-Opaque Tights: Labels may mention a denier level of 30 instead of 80.

Feel free to reach out if you have any other questions to hello@sheertex.com.

settings.title: Why can't you take them back when other intimates brands do?
settings.text: We definitely understand the concern - most intimates brands that take back their products destroy them immediately in order to preserve the sanitation of their facilities, which at this time is not a viable option for us given that we operate out of a small warehouse in Montreal.

settings.title: Can they be recycled?
settings.text: Our goal environmentally (and financially!) is to reduce the number of purchases of pantyhose overall - making sure fewer pairs of pantyhose end up in the landfill and thus you needing to buy fewer replacements over time. Although our fibre is not biodegradable, we‚Äôre aware of our impact on the environment and are proud to make our products and packaging as sustainable as possible.¬†While individual actions do not equate to the majority of the climate crisis, each small step is a good one, and we are working towards making our product fully circular, one day!

settings.title: Why are they so expensive?
settings.text: They are definitely an investment! We are proudly Canadian and we design, manufacture and ship all our products from our factory in Montreal. Our tights made ethically and with lots of love! Each pair contains $30USD of our super strong proprietary fiber and we pay competitive wages and benefits to all our employees.

settings.title: Why do they cost so much more than other brands?
settings.text: We totally understand your concern about this and we'd be happy to explain why our tights are priced where they are. We use the world‚Äôs strongest fibre, the same fibres used in bulletproof vests and climbing equipment. Our products are priced the way they are because each pair of Sheertex tights contains $35 worth of fibre compared to the pennies in disposable department store brands. Unlike other pantyhose, Sheertex sheers are stain, odor, and moisture resistant and naturally cooling. They also simply last longer than other brands, so they're capable of paying for themselves! As we scale up production, we hope to drive down our price!

settings.title: Did your prices go up?
settings.text: We'd love to provide context for this change! We standardized our pricing to better account for the materials and production costs of each of our items. We have been subsidizing the cost of the innovation in the market since our launch to put it in as many hands as possible. The new prices standardize pricing across our products and are a more accurate reflections of the cost of making and selling the product today. We‚Äôre still trying to figure out the sweet spot for our prices as we make everything on-site, and we updated these prices as soon as we had the information to do so. If you have any further questions, please do feel free to let us know!

settings.title: If they are made with $30 worth of fibre, why do they cost more than that?
settings.text: $30 USD is referring to the cost of raw material going into each pair. On top of that, there are employee wages, machinery, manufacturing and other costs to keep a business running. We produce ethically in Canada which means we pay competitive wages and benefits to every single employee in our offices and factory. This requires the price to be higher like you'll see in many other ethical brands. Traditional disposable pantyhose and fast fashion brands in general are typically made with pennies worth of material and produced in a way that is unethical. Though these items can come cheap, they have a ridiculously high markup compared to their material and moral value. We wanted a product that stands for our values all around. ü•∞ That being said, we'd love to make our tights more accessible as that becomes available to us. We are a quickly growing start-up right now, as we grow and are able to procure cost saving, we are excited to bring directly to our wonderful customers. ‚ù§Ô∏è

settings.paragraph_1: Hey there, it‚Äôs nice to meet you! Since you made it this far, we thought you might want to learn the story behind Sheertex. The Sheertex knit was first invented in 2017 by Katherine Homuth. The Sheertex knit is made from fibers traditionally reserved for high performance applications like ballistics and climbing equipment, which makes our apparel lighter and stronger than pretty much anything you'll find on the market today. We're committed to better, more sustainable textiles and every Sheertex product is manufactured by us at our Montreal HQ and factory.

settings.review: They look and feel great along with giving you confidence to dash into the garden, walking the dogs, messing with the cat without fear of snags and tears! No more having to stash an extra pair for an emergency!

I put Sheertex's tights to the real test. I pulled on them and they didn't rip, with no snags. I was genuinely impressed. Sheertex Shaping Sheer Tights have shapewear built-in to its design, so it's comfortable but also keeps me looking snatched.
Love these sheers! No visible lines under any kind of dress or skirt and are so comfortable	to wear all day. Perfect for spring/winter/fall seasons when bare legs aren‚Äôt an option.
I couldn‚Äôt believe what I had in my hands. Lol. I pulled, poked, twist, and stretched and still no rips or tears. Oh it felt so good against my hands and feet. This is a sure winner.

settings.title: Do you offer Tall sizes?
settings.text: We've moved away from height measurements in our size guide, since our products are made of a fundamentally elastic material (unlike denim, for example). We've found that sizing by weight is a more accurate guide for more body types. The size guide for each product can be found on the product page, under the tab "Size Guide." Of course, if you would like to verify your size, we would be more than happy to help! Just send us an email at hello@sheertex.com.

settings.title: How tall do your tights fit?
settings.text: Our tights can comfortably fit anyone up to 6 feet, but we have had customers who are taller who have found them a perfect fit! If you're worried, feel free to reach out to us at hello@sheertex.com!

settings.title: My tights don't fit.
settings.text: Oh no, we're sorry to hear this! Please send an email over to hello@sheertex.com so we can help you out.

settings.title: What inseam do they fit?
settings.text: Inseam measurements refer to the length of the inside part of the leg to the floor. This measurement is often used when referring to pants or skirts that are often made out of woven fabrics that have little to no stretch. You will often see this with jeans and that's how they are sized. The problem with referring to pantyhose with inseam length is because the knit of pantyhose is 4-way stretch. 4-way stretch knits allow the fabric to move in whatever direction is needed to fit the body and alter depending on the volume inside of the fabric.

settings.title: What is my skin tone?
settings.text: While we do not have swatches available available for our shades, what you can do is select your size and shade and be shown a model in that shade on the lefthand side. This way you can compare the different shades on various skintones to see which would be the best match.

settings.title: How thick are they?
settings.text: We offer a range of denier, from Ultrasheer 15 to Semi-Opaque 80!

settings.title: What is denier?
settings.text: Denier measures the thickness of fabric fibers. As denier count goes up, so do opacity and strength, and vice versa.

settings.title: Are they pantyhose?
settings.text: Pantyhose, tights, hosiery, sheers - whichever synonym you prefer, we've got a long-lasting option!

settings.title: Do you make maternity?
settings.text: First of all, congratulations! We've been hearing the request for maternity wear and it's definitely something we're interested in offering one day - we don't have any right now but I do really hope it will be added to our line soon.

settings.title: Do you make compression?
settings.text: Our tights do not have a compression component to them at this time. This is a super popular request and one we hope to fulfill as we grow as a company. Our Shaping Sheer Tights provide extra support in the tummy and upper thigh area, and our Hug Tight knee socks are a light support sock for the foot and calf. Those might be something to check out!

settings.title: Do you make nude tights?
settings.text: After much consideration, we‚Äôve officially paused production of our nude tights until they better meet our high standards. Nude tights require a different process than our black, patterned, and coloured tights, which made it particularly challenging to meet our standards. Simply put, making the perfect pair of resilient nude tights produces more waste than we are willing to accept. We are continuing to do further research and development to make our nude tights the best they can possibly be.
